Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
bosomy \bos"om*y\ (b[oo^]z"[u^]m*[y^]), a. 1. Characterized by recesses or sheltered hollows. [1913 Webster]
2. Having a large bosom; -- of a woman. [PJC]

bosomy adj : (of a woman's body) having a large bosom and pleasing curves; "Hollywood seems full of curvaceous blondes"; "a curvy young woman in a tight dress" [syn: {busty}, {buxom}, {curvaceous}, {curvy}, {full-bosomed}, {sonsie}, {sonsy}, {voluptuous}, {well-endowed}]
